Player History
Had first career hit (double) on 3/31/2013, off Jose Fernandez (MIA)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/5/2013, off Scott Rice (NYM)...
Traded from Chicago (N) to Detroit on 2/20/2014 (Going to CHC: P Justin Verlander, RF Nick Castellanos, CF Austin Schotts. Going to DET: 1B Anthony Rizzo, SS Asdrubal Cabrera)...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/1/2015, hitting .435 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Traded from Detroit to Seattle on 2/18/2019 (Going to SEA: DH Anthony Rizzo. Going to DET: SS Dawel Lugo, SS Stephen Drew, CF Michael Saunders)...
Was selected to the 2019 Allstar game...
8/9/2019: Signed a contract extension with Seattle, $15,000,000 per year, for 2 years.
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Kansas City on 5/14/2020...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/15/2020, hitting .565 with 1 HR, 11 RBI...
8/9/2021: Signed a contract extension with Seattle, $20,000,000 per year, for 2 years.
Won World Series with Seattle in 2021...
Drove in 6 runs against Texas on 6/4/2022...
Injured on 6/8/2022 with a Fractured Knee, out for 5 weeks...
Injured on 10/9/2022 with a Scratched Cornea Eye, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Series with Seattle in 2022...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Kansas City on 7/24/2023...
10/24/2023: Signed a contract extension with Seattle, $21,800,000 per year, for 3 years.
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Detroit on 5/20/2024...
Drove in 6 runs against Oakland on 7/2/2025...
Had 2000th career hit on 8/15/2026, off Seve Lorenz (DET)...
Signed as a free agent by St. Louis on 2/16/2027 to a 2-year deal worth $15,000,000 per year...
